On Sun, Aug 17, 2008 at 8:32 AM, Victor Grazi <vgrazi@...> wrote:
> What is the best practice for testing a simple database query that generates
> several thousand moderately complex records of XML.
> Data is constantly changing, so it wouldn't make sense to test against real
> data.
> I am thinking the tester should create a test table, populate it with
> contrived data, and then just read the generated XML against the known
> result.
> Is there a more elegant solution?

If you want to test the query, then it might be enough to put one
record that matches the query and one record that doesn't match the
query into the database table and run the query, expecting only the
one record back. If you wrote a test like this, how confident would
you feel in the correctness of the query?

Of course, you must use a test database.
http://www.dallaway.com/acad/dbunit.html#four

Take care.
